function-definition.name: gdata-service-source
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a string Return the name of the user's application.

function-definition.name: check-account-type
function-definition.documentation-string: Check if the Google account type is available.The Google account type. Must be one of:google, :hosted-or-google or :hostedTrue is this Google account type is available.gdata-error

variable-definition.name: +gdata-created+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Creation of a resource was successful.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-bad-request+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Invalid request URI or header, or unsupported nonstandard parameter.

function-definition.name: gdata-service-password
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a string Return the password of the Google account.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-ok+
variable-definition.documentation-string: No error.

function-definition.name: gdata-service-email
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a string Return the email of the Google account.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-forbidden+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Unsupported standard parameter, or authentication or authorization failed.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-internal-error+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Internal error. This is the default code that is used for all unrecognizederrors.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-conflict+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Specified version number doesn't match resource's latest version number.

function-definition.name: gdata-service-auth
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a string The auth token used for authenticating requests

function-definition.name: gdata-service-account-type
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a keyword Return the type of account to use. Use :google forregular Google accounts or :hosted for Google Apps accounts,or :hosted-or-google to try finding a hosted account first and, if it doesn't exist, try finding a regular Google account.Default value: :hosted-or-google.

variable-definition.name: +gdata-unauthorized+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Authorization required.

function-definition.name: authenticates
function-definition.documentation-string: Make a HTTP request to authenticate. If HTTP return code is 200, update the AUTH token of gdata-service.a gdata-service instancegdata-service-errorgdata-error

variable-definition.name: +gdata-not-found+
variable-definition.documentation-string: Resource (such as a feed or entry) not found.

class-definition.name: gdata-request-error
class-definition.documentation-string: Condition raised when an invalide request to theGoogle web services is performed.

class-definition.name: gdata-service-error
class-definition.documentation-string: Condition raised when the Google web services are down.

function-definition.name: gdata-service-service
function-definition.documentation-string: a gdata-service a string The desired service for which credentials willbe obtained.

class-definition.name: gdata-service
class-definition.documentation-string: The superclass of all Google service.Subclasses of gdata-service represents Google service available using cl-gdata : Picasa.gdata-service-emailgdata-service-passwordgdata-service-account-typegdata-service-servicegdata-service-sourcegdata-service-auth

variable-definition.name: +gdata-not-modified+
variable-definition.documentation-string: The resource hasn't changed since the time specified in the request'sIf-Modified-Since header.

variable-definition.name: *login-url*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to account authentication

function-definition.name: make-request
function-definition.documentation-string: Make an HTTP request to Google.a gdata-service instanceThe HTTP request to performeThe HTTP method. Must be :get, :post, :delete or :putSpecify if the request is done with authentification or nota stringgdata-request-errorReturn a string which contains XML data.

variable-definition.name: *service*
variable-definition.documentation-string: Name of the Google service for which authorization is requested.

variable-definition.name: *debug*
variable-definition.documentation-string: If T, active some logs.

package.name: cl-gdata-picasa
package.documentation-string: cl-gdata-picasa package. The Picasa Web Albums Data API allows for websites and programs to integrate with Picasa Web Albums.

variable-definition.name: *print-picasa*
variable-definition.documentation-string: If T, write the customized presentation of the cl-gdata-picasa objects.

function-definition.name: list-albums
function-definition.documentation-string: Get a feed of an user's albums.a gdata-picasa instanceAn usernameSpecify if the request is done with authentification or notA stringgdata-request-errorReturn a string in XML format which contains the list of albums.

function-definition.name: make-gdata-picasa
function-definition.documentation-string: Creates a new gdata-picasa object.The email of the Google accountThe password of the Google accountgdata-error

function-definition.name: add-album
function-definition.documentation-string: Add a new album for user. Needs authentication.a gdata-picasa instanceAn usernameTitle of the photos albunA summary / description for this albumPlace for a geolocation of this albumprivate or public. Public albums are searchable by everyone on the internet. Defaults to publicA String, keywords separated by comaA stringReturn a string which contains XML format representing the new album feed.

function-definition.name: add-photo
function-definition.documentation-string: Add a photo for user's album. Needs authentication.a gdata-picasa instanceAn usernameName of the photos albunThe image filenameA stringReturn a string which contains XML format representing the photo feed.

function-definition.name: list-photos
function-definition.documentation-string: Get a feed listing all of the photos in an album belonging to an user.a gdata-picasa instanceAn usernameName of the photos albunSpecify if the request is done with authentification or notA string Return a string in XML format which contains the list of photos in this album.gdata-request-error

variable-definition.name: *add-album*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to add a new album.

variable-definition.name: *list-photos*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to get a feed listing all of the photos in an album.

variable-definition.name: *delete-album*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to delete an album.

variable-definition.name: *service*
variable-definition.documentation-string: The service name for Picasa.

variable-definition.name: *delete-image*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to add a new image to an album.

variable-definition.name: *add-image*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to add a new image to an album.

variable-definition.name: *list-albums*
variable-definition.documentation-string: URL to get a feed of albums.

function-definition.name: delete-album
function-definition.documentation-string: Delete an new album for user. Needs authentication.a gdata-picasa instanceAn usernameTitle of the photos albunA stringReturn a string which contains XML format representing the deleted album feed.

variable-definition.name: *debug*
variable-definition.documentation-string: If T active some logs for debug.
